prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would. When three positive integers are divided by $12$, the remainders are $7,$ $9,$ and $10,$ respectively.

When the sum of the three integers is divided by $12$, what is the remainder?
solution:
We can call the three integers in this problem $a,$ $b,$ and $c$. Then we have \begin{align*}
a &\equiv 7\pmod{12}, \\
b &\equiv 9\pmod{12}, \\
c &\equiv 10\pmod{12}.
\end{align*}Adding these congruences, we have \begin{align*}
a+b+c &\equiv 7+9+10 \\
&= 26\pmod{12}.
\end{align*}Therefore, $a+b+c$ has the same remainder as $26$ upon division by $12$. This remainder is $\boxed{2}$.
gpt_response:
Let the three positive integers be denoted as $a,$ $b,$ and $c$, where $a \equiv 7 \pmod{12}$, $b \equiv 9 \pmod{12}$, and $c \equiv 10 \pmod{12}$.

Therefore, we can express $a$ as $a = 12n + 7$, $b$ as $b = 12m + 9$, and $c$ as $c = 12k + 10$, where $n$, $m$, and $k$ are integer coefficients.

The sum of the three integers, $a + b + c$, can be written as:
$$a + b + c = (12n + 7) + (12m + 9) + (12k + 10) = 12(n + m + k) + 26$$

Since $n + m + k$ is an integer, when the sum of the three integers is divided by $12$, the remainder will be $26 \pmod{12}$, which simplifies to $2$.

Therefore, the remainder when the sum of the three integers is divided by $12$ is $\boxed{2}$.

The sum of the three integers, $a + b + c$, can be written as:

Since $n + m + k$ is an integer, when the sum of the three integers is divided by $12$, the remainder will be $26 \pmod{12}$, which simplifies to $2$.
